name: Jobs
body:
##Ten jobs that for one reason or another piqued my interest this week that I thought I'd share in case anybody was feeling the Friday fear!

**Sunday, 28th June 2015.**

[Digital Product Manager at the Economist which has always seemed one of those few long established  publications that 'get' digital]( https://careers-economist.icims.com/jobs/2083/digital-product-manager/job?mode=view&mobile=false&width=658&height=500&bga=true&needsRedirect=false&jan1offset=0&jun1offset=60)

[Head of Digital for the RAC - Aztec West the most soul-less place in Bristol but just up the road from me :) ](http://rac.amris.com/wizards_v2/rac/vacancyView.php?requirementId=1487)

[The Tate's Head of Digital Content](https://workingat.tate.org.uk/pages/job_search_view.aspx?jobId=2206&JobIndex=3&categoryList=&workingPatternList=&locations=&group=&keywords=default&PageIndex=1&Number=3) not many places where you are going to get better content to play with online!

[Head of Digital Library Services, Institute of Cancer Research](http://www.jobs.ac.uk/job/ALK881/head-of-digital-library-services/) one for the Jiscy crowd - I still have a soft spot for digital libraries and innovation in scholarly communications.

[Director of Kings Digital Laboratory](https://www.hirewire.co.uk/HE/1061247/MS_JobDetails.aspx?JobID=62584) To be honest even after reading the job description a couple of time I'm not sure what this job will actually do - my academic-ese is rusty - but it is intriguing for sure!

[The Communications Manager at the new Digital Service at Parliament](http://jobs.theguardian.com/job/6110246/communications-manager/?LinkSource=PremiumListing ) will have the opportunity to be a part of some potentially huge and important changes as Parliament embraces a new digital attitude under their new CDO.]

[Digital Project Manager for the wonderful SS Great Britain one of Brunel's great achievements as well as a favourite Bristol landmark.](http://www.bristolmedia.co.uk/job/3689/digital-project-manager?o=20&type=2&sby=2&tr=111&sc=&b=&keyword=)

[UCAS in Cheltenham are looking for a Digital Performance Manager](https://www.ucas.com/corporate/join-our-team/job-vacancies/digital-performance-manager) It is a pretty wide ranging role and there is something I've always found fascinating about the role of UCAS in UK higher education. 

[Head of Product Management](http://www.eduserv.org.uk/about/jobs/Head-of-Product-Management) up in the clouds. Well for Eduserv in Bath and their 'cloud' products.  

Something a bit different to finish on. DXW are looking for a [Business Development Manager](https://www.dxw.com/jobs/business-development-manager/) but they see the role a [bit differently](https://www.dxw.com/2015/05/sales-as-a-useful-service/) than most and that is what makes it interesting.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
